title: How to Make Pumpkin Spice Cupcakes

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (177 °C) and place baking cups in a 12 cup muffin pan.
steps.description: If you don't have baking cups, you can spray the holes with non-stick cooking spray.

steps.headline: Whisk all dry ingredients in a bowl and set aside.
steps.description: Be sure that there are no sugar or flour lumps.

steps.headline: Beat wet ingredients in a separate bowl with an electric mixer until smooth.
steps.description: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.

steps.headline: Mix well.
steps.description: Make sure that there are no lumps. Pour the batter into muffin cups.

steps.headline: Bake the cupcakes for 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cream icing sugar and butter until smooth.
Add cream cheese and mix with a mixer until there are no lumps.
Mix the last three ingredients in.
steps.description: If the cinnamon flavour is too weak, feel free to add more.

text: Making the Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350°F (177 °C) and place baking cups in a 12 cup muffin pan. If you don't have baking cups, you can spray the holes with non-stick cooking spray. Whisk all dry ingredients in a bowl and set aside. Be sure that there are no sugar or flour lumps. Beat wet ingredients in a separate bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Mix well. Make sure that there are no lumps. Pour the batter into muffin cups. Bake the cupcakes for 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Making the Frosting Cream icing sugar and butter until smooth.  Add cream cheese and mix with a mixer until there are no lumps.  Mix the last three ingredients in. If the cinnamon flavour is too weak, feel free to add more. Ice the cupcakes. Enjoy!
